name: Straight Bar Cable Front Raise
how_to_perform:
1. Stand facing the cable machine with the bar at chest height.

2. Grip the bar with your hands shoulder-width apart and your palms facing each other.

3. Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, lift the bar forward by bending your elbows out to the sides until it is in line with your shoulders.

4. Hold for a brief moment to engage the muscle.

5. Slowly return the bar to the starting position by extending your elbows and lowering the weight straight down.

6. Repeat on the other side.

7. Alternate legs and continue for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: A cable-based exercise that targets the anterior deltoids, helping develop stronger shoulders with a focus on front raises.
